items.text: one way could be to encrypt it using a passcode.

items.text: Client will use this passcode to encrypt user’s email ID and send to the server.
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: Server will, in turn, use the same passcode to decrypt the data received from the client.
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: If during the transmission of the data someone gets access to the transmitting data, he/ she wouldn’t be able to make sense of it as it is encrypted.
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: This kind of encryption technique is called symmetric encryption.
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: What if there was an encryption technique where the algorithm would generate a key pair for you comprising of 2 keys.
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: This kind of encryption technique is called asymmetric encryption.
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: So now it is clear that you can’t use symmetric encryption because you can’t ship the passcode in your app.
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: Using an asymmetric encryption (say RSA), the server generates a key pair consisting of a public key and a private key.
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: Server saves these keys in a secure location.
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: We take public key and ship it in our app (client).
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: When we want to transfer some sensitive data to server (at runtime), we generate a passcode (aka secret key) using a symmetric encryption (say AES).
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: Using this secret key we encrypt our large texts of data quickly.
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: Now we use the public key to encrypt our secret key.
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: We send this encrypted data and encrypted secret key combination to server (using any commonly used way to send combination of data, like JSON)
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: Server receives this combination, extracts encrypted data and encrypted secret key from it.
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: Server uses private key to decrypt the encrypted secret key.
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: Server uses decrypted secret key (or simply called secret key) to decrypt the encrypted data.
items.href: How to pass large data between server and client (android) securely? | by Mayank Mohan Upadhyay | MindOrks | Medium

items.text: This technique is called Hybrid Cryptography.
